title: New Resolve
opening: At last, Eliwood's long-awaited reunion with his father, as well as their painful farewell. After escaping the Dread Isle, they return to the port city of Badon. Eliwood remains silent for the duration of their passage. He sits cradling his father's cold hand as if to warm him back to life.

They find the man for whom they've been searching, Marquess Pherae. He breathes his last in the embrace of his son, Eliwood. The companions leave the Dragon's Gate and set sail for Badon. Eliwood is grief-stricken at his father's death. Hector can find no words to comfort his friend.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: ...Ninian, are you feeling better?

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: Yes…

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: That’s good. ...Long time, no see, Nils. You’ve grown, haven’t you?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: ...Is it really you, Lyndis? It seems like it’s been so long.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Even though it’s only been a year since I saw you last?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: So much has happened since we left you and Caelin.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Hey, care to talk about things the rest of us can follow?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Hmph. Who’s he?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: This is Hector. He’s Marquess Ostia’s brother. Don’t let his attitude fool you. He acts mean, but he’s decent enough.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Acts mean seems pretty mean to me!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Heehee… And you might remember this one. He’s...

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Yep, I remember. He’s the man who helped Ninian. You’re Elbert’s son, aren’t you? Your red hair, gentle eyes, and even voice. You’re just like him.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Where did you meet my father?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: At the Dragon’s Gate. He set us free after we’d been captured. We escaped in a small boat, but I was thrown out in a storm. When I woke up, I was back on Valor. For a time, I hid in the ruins by myself. Then... I sensed something really dangerous. When I raced to the Dragon’s Gate, I... I saw everything.

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: ...Nils.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: When we pulled Ninian from the boat, she’d lost her memory. I can’t believe we brought her right back to her captors. What a horrible thing to do. ...I’m sorry.

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: Lady Lyn... Lady Lyn, you did nothing wrong...... When Nils fell overboard, I didn’t know what to do. ...I became lost within myself. If only I’d been stronger... ......All of this could have been avoided... I am... truly... sorry.

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: …Ninian’s power is greater than mine, but it costs her physical and emotional strength. ......Nergal exploited that... weakness...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: ...Ninian... Nils...

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: ...Was he after you because you have the power to call dragons?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: ...I think it’s because we can open the Dragon’s Gate. Just calling them? Nergal can do that on his own.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Are you serious?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Yes, but it requires a tremendous amount of quintessence.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Quintessence?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: That’s what Nergal called it. The substance of the human spirit... Power. Energy. The essence of life itself. ...Nergal, he stole this quintessence.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: ...What happens to those whose quintessence is stolen?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: ...They... They die...

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Neither Ninian nor I have that power. Lyn knows. We only have our special power... Anyway, Nergal needed to gather a large amount of quintessence. So he sent his henchman, Ephidel, to get close to Marquess Laus. He sought to plant the seeds of war in Darin’s power-hungry heart.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: ...To what end?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: It seems the quintessence in each person varies in strength. A person of strong mind and body has hundreds of times more energy than the average person. It sounds like there aren’t many people like that, though. It took too long for Nergal to find people with enough strength. Although it would take time, Nergal said the easiest way to get that much quintessence was by starting a war.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: ...So he planned to make up for quality with quantity? Is that it? Black-hearted fiend! Are all men nothing but pawns to him?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: ...Ephidel brought Elbert to the Dragon’s Gate. He said he’d found the ideal source they had sought. Nergal’s plans for war had been stopped, and yet... he was happy. He’d taken so much energy from the knights traveling with Elbert. He was sure he’d get even better quintessence from Elbert...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Nils!

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Oh, I’m sorry... Lord Eliwood.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: It’s all right... ...When I found my father at the Dragon’s Gate, I knew his knights were no longer alive...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Eliwood...

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: ...Your father told us that he had a son. He said you were blessed with natural fighting ability. But he also told us you were compassionate and disdained fighting. He told us that his son would be a better ruler than he was.

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: He told us that he would sooner sacrifice himself than see his homeland, Lycia, embroiled in the flames of war.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: ...That’s...

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: When we’d lost all hope at the Dragon’s Gate, your father always spoke to us of happy things. ...Well, he mainly spoke of his cherished son and his dear wife, but Ninian and I... We loved him very much. His stories about his family... ...They saved us.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Oh, Fa-- ...Father... ......

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: ...Hector?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: We should let him be alone for a while…

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: ...Sure. Come on, Ninian, Nils.

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: …As you say.

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: ...Lord Eliwood...

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Hm? Ninian... I didn’t see you. I’m sorry about before. I just... needed some time to think.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Should you be up? You’ve had a rough time... Your coloring’s not very good. You should rest.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: ...Look at you, all scratches and bruises... You need to be properly taken care of...

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: ...Why?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Hm?

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: Why was Lord Elbert so… Lord Eliwood, why were you both... so kind to us? It's... This is… This is all my fault… These nightmares... All these terrible things...

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Ninian, crying ill suits a girl of your beauty. I’m fine... Please don’t cry.

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: I’m sorry... So... sorry...

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: There’s something you must hear. You’re not responsible for what happened to my father. You suffered as much as he did. Please don’t punish yourself further.

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: ...Lord Eliwood... I... I... Ah!!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Huh? What is it?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Ninian?

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: ...Enemies... ......Enemies draw near!!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: So, what do we do now?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I wonder what happened to Nergal. Lord Elbert gave him a grievous wound when he stabbed him.

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: His wounds will not kill him.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: That’s what Lord Elbert said, too. Do you know what he meant?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Nergal uses quintessence on himself as well. His wounds heal quickly. …His body does not age.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: So he isn’t... human?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: ...If nothing else, he’s... Ah!!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: What is it?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Call everyone! Enemies approach!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Bah. Eliwood deserves a little more time to rest...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Well then, we’ll handle this ourselves, shall we?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Here you all are!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Ah!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Eliwood!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Listen! Get ready for battle! I want to get this over with quickly to protect villagers. Meet the enemy commander, and drive them out of here!!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Het, little guy! Go hide in the village!

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: No way! I can help you out!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Nils, you really are a big help, but... shouldn’t you be with Ninian now?

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Ah... All right!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Let’s go!

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: Ninian! Stop! Where are you going?

battle.speaker: Ninian
battle.line: I... I’m going to help!

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: Oh, no, you’re not! You’re still too weak!

battle.speaker: Ninian
battle.line: But... I merely wish to help Lord Eliwood… Even if just a little. I... I stole his father’s life from him... ...I know this... this will never make up for it... Nils! Please...

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: ...I understand. Give me your hands.

battle.speaker: Ninian
battle.line: Nils?

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: I’ll give you some of my power. You’ll just get in the way if you go out like this.

battle.speaker: Ninian
battle.line: Nils, I’m sorry.

battle.speaker: Nils
battle.line: ...Whew! That should do it. Help them for me, too.

battle.speaker: Ninian
battle.line: Thank you.

battle.speaker: Ninian
battle.line: Lord Eliwood!

battle.speaker: Eliwood
battle.line: Ninian!? You shouldn’t be here!!

battle.speaker: Ninian
battle.line: ...Please allow me to help.

battle.speaker: Eliwood
battle.line: Help? I’ve no intention of making you fight...

battle.speaker: Ninian
battle.line: ...I’m no mere dancer. My dances... They will help you.

battle.speaker: Eliwood
battle.line: ...This is...... I’m wrapped in... some sort of... energy...

battle.speaker: Ninian
battle.line: I used Ninis’s Grace and danced for you, Lord Eliwood. It will only last a short while, but while it does, you are protected. ...Please... allow me... to remain at your side.

battle.speaker: Eliwood
battle.line: Ninian... Of course. If it will make you feel better. Let’s rejoin the battle. Don’t leave my side.

battle.speaker: Ninian
battle.line: OK!

battle.speaker: Ninian
battle.line: Mark, please tell me what you want me to do. I cannot fight, but... I can aid with my dance. I ask for your understanding and assistance.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Can’t believe Badon’s under attack. If only Fargus were here... Say, I’ve got something here you can use to buy some time. Set this Light Rune, and it’ll block the enemies’ advance. Only thing is, it’ll stop allies, too. So... watch your step!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Ah... Those emerald eyes, that lustrous blue hair... She was... so beautiful, beautiful beyond words… If only I could see her again... A lovely knight of Pherae, searching for her lord... ...I wonder why she’s a knight. A famed knight and me, that’s a dream of a dream... Wah! You... I... I was just thinking out loud... You... didn’t hear anything, did you? Waaaaaaaaa! You mustn’t tell anyone! Promise me! You mustn’t!!

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Why all the noise? It’s the middle of the night!! What? A fight? Are you going to do something? Really? Then... here, take this. It should aid you. It’s a Restore staff. It’ll wake you from sleep and cure poison. Basically, it’ll cure what’s wrong and bring you back to normal. Now I’m tired... Why can’t you people fight at a decent hour?

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Are you a mercenary? You all look like you’ve been fighting for years and years. What kind of tactician would put together a group like yours?

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Hey! Wasn’t that a wyvern rider that flew by here a while back!? I want to know what Bern’s wyvern riders are doing here! Are we under attack? C’mon, do something! I’ve heard that wyvern riders are fast and really tough. Sure, arrows and magic can bring them down, but... This’ll cause ‘em trouble, too! It’s a wyrmslayer. Here! Take care of ‘em!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: You need special items to change classes. The item’s different for different units, too. Cavaliers and knights need a Knight crest. Folks skilled in magic and staves need a Guiding ring. And wyvern riders and Pegasus knights need this: an Elysian whip. You can have it. Don’t be shy now. It’s not like I’ll ever be able to use it. Now, if I were a cute little Pegasus knight, I’d use it in an instant!

boss.speaker: Oleg
boss.line: It ends here. Your journey is over, and only oblivion awaits you.

boss.speaker: Oleg
boss.line: In defeat... there is only... death. Urgh......

boss.speaker: Oleg
boss.line: I bring an invitation from my master, Nergal. "Return the children to me." Seems foolish to deliver the message... After all, I can take them both myself and go now!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Hey, are you OK?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Mm. Sorry to worry you.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: You don’t have to push yourself so.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: We’ll have time for mourning when this is all finished. For now, in my father’s name... I will do everything I can to stop Nergal and protect our lands.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I see. So what do you have in mind?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: ...We need to see Marquess Ostia.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: My brother?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: After all we’ve learned... We can’t not tell him, can we?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Sure, I guess...

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Hector? Why that odd expression?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hector doesn’t want to meet Lord Uther. He’s been lax in contacting him and is afraid to face him, right?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: What! And how did you expect me to send him messages when we’re traipsing about the isles like merchants on holidays?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Ha ha ha! He is going to be so mad!!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: C’mere!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Ha... They’re both in good spirits. ...It’s a lot better than giving in to despair, I suppose.

end.speaker: Marcus
end.line: Lord Eliwood... Are you feeling better?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Marcus... I’m fine. I know I worried you.

end.speaker: Marcus
end.line: About Lord Elbert... At my own discretion, I sent a messenger to Lady Eleanora.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: ...I see. Thank you, Marcus. That was well done.

end.speaker: Marcus
end.line: ...I thought she should know as soon as possible. The marquess’s final moments were so... very noble...
Lord Eliwood! Commander Marcus!!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Ah!!

end.speaker: Marcus
end.line: Is... Is that you, Isadora?!

end.speaker: Isadora
end.line: I’ve finally found you. I’m glad you’re well...

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Isadora, what are you doing here? Don’t tell me something’s happened to Mother...

end.speaker: Isadora
end.line: No, Lady Eleanora is well. Do not worry. When word of Lord Elbert’s death reached her yesterday... She said not a word... She merely gave her full attention to the messenger.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: ...Mother.

end.speaker: Isadora
end.line: Then, she issued me orders without hesitation. She commanded I deliver this sword to Lord Eliwood and remain at his side.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: But... the castle defenses will be shorthanded.

end.speaker: Isadora
end.line: Lord Eliwood... please... Understand your mother’s feelings. Lord Elbert is not coming home. All your mother can do now is pray for your continued safety. "Obey your father’s dying wish." That is her message to you, and I have delivered it.

end.speaker: Marcus
end.line: Why not petition Ostia for reinforcements to help ward Castle Pherae?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: ...Good idea. I guess it would ease my mother’s fears and bow to her wishes.

end.speaker: Isadora
end.line: It’s that thinking that makes you Lord Eliwood.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Our battles are like nothing you’ve ever prepared for. ...Are you ready to face them, Isadora?

end.speaker: Isadora
end.line: Yes. I will serve with my very life.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Tactician? Is something wrong? Oh, you were worried about me. I apologize for all of the trouble. I’m fine now. I have my friends to lean on. Hector, Lyndis, and you, Tactician... Thanks to all of you, I’m getting stronger. I am coming to believe that together, we can overcome anything!

end.speaker: Nergal
end.line: Sonia. Limstella.

end.speaker: Sonia
end.line: You called, Lord Nergal?

end.speaker: Nergal
end.line: My wound... needs time. It was a deep cut, and my strength is not what it was. The man who did this to me is dead. I’d like his son’s death as compensation. Sonia. You will use Brendan to move the Black Fang. I do not need mere underlings now. I need the Four Fangs.

end.speaker: Sonia
end.line: Hee hee, leave it to me. I’ll have them bowing their heads to you, my lord.

end.speaker: Nergal
end.line: Limstella. I want you to gather me quintessence. For this injury to heal, I will need much. You are the strongest of all my morphs. Kill all those who bear signs of great power.

end.speaker: Limstella
end.line: As you will...
